Text: With a leveled balance, we say good bye to all of you from Mendoza. Argentina gained 4 points, Cuba took 2 and we all enjoyed a couple of fantastic volleyball nights. Hope you all had fun as we did. See you next time, volley-lovers!

After the match, Julio Velasco reassured: "As we said yesterday, this could be a different game. And it was. Cuba's serving put us under pressure the whole game. We had some good moments, but overall they played better."
Even though it's all Cuban joy in Mendoza, Argentina players remained with the fans for a while giving away autographs and souvenirs. But of course, these guys will celebrate the most tonight...
Talking stats: There was a major difference for Cuba and it was from the service line. The visiting side completed 9 aces against none from Argentina.
Talking stats: Rolando Cepeda topped all charts with an amazing total of 28 points, vital for this Cuban win.
This is Cuba's first win at 2015 World League! Finally they snap out of their losing streak and collect their first two points at Pool C.
14-8 for Cuba after a wide ball and MVP Cepeda finishes it off! It's 15-9 for Cuba!
Oh... Jiménez had pulled out another block giving Cuba a 11-7 lead, but he celebrated way too much and he received a red card. It's now 11-8.
After a block, Cepeda shouts as the entire venue falls into silence. The problem for the noisy home fans is that Cuba is now 10-7 ahead...
Things remain close as the teams exchange courts. Uriarte was the last scorer, the one that gave Cuba a slim 8-7 lead.
Well, Cuba is proving us wrong. Fantastic one-on-one block by Osoria and his side is now 6-5.
Amazing! Two fine digs by Closter in the same rally and Argentina is now 5-4. Key point?
Still close, 3-3. Cuba is showing more spirit but Argentina is also in good shape.
Will this tie-break be as close as the game? So far, it's 1-1...
Bruno was the key player for Argentina in the fourth set - 6 points added to his total of 15, though he's still far away from Cepeda, with 26 tallies.
There it is! Classic block-out by Bruno and Argentina win the set by 25-16. Fifth and decisive set in Mendoza!
The first tie-break of Pool C is about to become true. Another failed Cuban serve places Argentina at 24-16 and the whole venue is waiting...
Cuba is doing their share now as well. Two serves died at the net providing Argentina a 20-13 on the board.
We should be getting ready for a tie-break, because Argentina is now 16-10 and their attack is almost flawless.
Fine work from Argentina's outside spikers - it's now Bruno the one who succeeds to 14-9 and opposite Martina joins for a clear 15-9 lead.
Jumps like a Cuban! Great skills for home boy Zornetta as he chains two spikes and Argentina move to 12-6.
Bruno now blocks firmly and the first TTO shows Argentina ahead by four (8-4).
We hope you are comfortable, because home favourites are back on track in the fourth set! Bruno finds his way to score and Martina serves well for 7-3 numbers.
Are you keeping track on Cepeda's scoring? He's 21 points after the 2-1 - an average of 7 per set. Good work!
Cuban fans in Mendoza are surely happy! Their team clinches their first point at 2015 FIVB World League with this 2-1 score.
Argentina managed to save two set balls, but Cepeda did it again and Cuba improved to 2-1 with a final 25-21.
Wow! A tremendous serve by Jiménez crashes into Villalba's chest! Nobody's hurt, but Cuba is now 24-19.
It's time for more action by Cepeda, as he successfully spikes to bring calm to his side (23-19).
Argentina is working hard to stay there - sweet one-handed set by Chirivino and Crer smashes to put things closer at 21-19.
Cuba is all fired-up now! Argentina is trying to dig, but the Caribbean are much more persistent and keep spiking to 19-14.
Outstanding athletic skills by Jiménez now! He jumps high, saves the ball from a block-out and Cepeda scores the 16-13 for Cuba.
It's all about focus in Mendoza, as Jiménez sends the ball wide creating a 13-point tie.
The errors apparently moved to Argentina now. Velasco is not happy and stops the game with Cuba ahead 12-10.
Nice way for Osmany Uriarte to wash away the last ball! Solid block over Martina and Cuba is back at 9-9!
This might be decisive for the set... Cuba's Uriarte sends a ball straight on the antenna and Argentina seize a small 8-6 lead.
However, Argentina won't let go. With bench players Martina and Villalba on court, the home squad levels the score at 5 points each.
Another service point by Cepeda - this time placing Cuba ahead by 4-2 in the third set.
After a marvelous second set, Cepeda has now improved his numbers to 12 points, maintaining Cuba on track in Mendoza.
The set finishes the way it's supposed to: with Cepeda. Cuba level the game with the same score than the first, but reversed - 25-17 and 1-1 overall.
Setter Calvo can also spike! And he's the one pushing Cuba to set ball (24-16).
This time, Cuba is doing everything right. Jiménez attacks to 21-13 and even though Martina sends a ball straight to his face afterwards, he's not demoralised at all.
A powerful serve by Cuba's Calvo creates an 18-10 score. The tie seems to be round the corner...
When things get tough for Cuba, there's Cepeda. The left-handed spiker succeeds and his time is now 16-9.
But wait! Ramos unveils a nice block and the gap shortens to 13-8.
If Cuba continue to attack this way, there's no turning back. A convincing performance enables a 12-5 score for them.
Although Argentina seem recovered, they still need some extra effort to claw their way back. Cuba is keeping control to 10-3.
It's time for some more new faces in Argentina - Rodrigo Villalba enters for the first time and it works! Argentina earn their first point, but Cuba lead 7-1.
What a player! Cepeda also digs and allows team-mate Jiménez to widen the gap to 6-0.
And is Cepeda the man in charge of sparking Cuba's hopes - strong serving to a solid 4-0 margin in the second set.
So far, Rolando Cepeda is leading the scorers' table with 6 kills. Crer and Ramos are tied for Argentina with 4 points apiece.
Amazing one-handed dig by Zornetta and González spikes for a final 25-17 score! Argentina takes a 1-0 lead.
World League debut for Argentina's Luciano Zornetta! He jumps onto the court with his side ahead 23-17.
Nope. Great block by Martín Ramos and the South American side is now 23-16!
Rivera enters the court for Uriarte in Cuba. They need to climb back from a 22-16 disadvantage.
Argentina lead by four in the final track - 20-16 but Cuba resist.
One more step for the hosts after a counterattack by González. Cuban coach Sánchez calls for a timeout trailing 18-14.
Ohhh tough call! A Crer's block lands very close to the sideline and even though Cuba is not happy, is called in. Argentina now leads 16-13.
Cepeda is having a much better night as he spikes well for Cuba. 12-12.
Nice work by Poglajen in a tough point for Argentina, but things are still close at 10-10.
Two spikes from Crer allow Argentina to keep control - it's 8-7 at the first TTO.
Quick comeback for the hosts and the score is 6-5, but the plot remains tight.
Velasco was right - tonight is already different. Cuba grabs a small lead at 4-3 with a nice block by Jiménez.
Let's get loud! Mendoza celebrates first home point with José Luis González!

The home team tonight: Demián González, José Luis González, Pablo Crer, Martín Ramos, Nicolás Bruno, Cristian Poglajen and Sebastián Closter (libero). Local opposite González replaces Federico Martina as the only change from Friday.

Cuba is on court! Setter Ricardo Calvo, opposite Rolando Cepeda, middle-blockers Dariel Albo and Liván Osoria, outside spikers Javier Jiménez and Osmany Uriarte, and libero Yonder García. Same starters than last night.
International referees being presented now. Peru's Walter Vera will be 1st referee and Brazil's Rogerio Espicalsky will join him as 2nd.
And now, time for the hosts!
All is respect in Mendoza while the Cuban anthem is playing.
We're almost there people! Official warm up at the net is finished and we are about to hear the anthems...
Aaaaaaargentina! As the team is introduced, Polideportivo Torito Rodríguez is getting louder and louder!

Injuries continue to curse the Cuban team. Not only Lázaro Fundora is out of the roster that's warming up now in Mendoza, but Osniel Rendón suffered a knee injury at a training in Argentina and is also out of the scene.

At this moment, official TV broadcast is starting in Mendoza, for all over the world. Recognise this face? It's Argentinian star Hugo Conte, who's now also well-known as a TV commentator for the national team.
Don't forget! You can interact with us using FIVB Social Media accounts - find us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Youtube and more!
And that's not all for the Caribbean side. Tonight, Cuba will be trying to avoid a fourth consecutive loss which would match their worst World League start - in 2002 and 2013.
Cuba is on the other side of this story - stuck with no wins after three World League matches played already. Last year they were Group 3 champions and they look forward to rise up to the challenge.
It was also the first time in 16 years Argentina pulled out a World League win over Cuba, and that same 1999 match was the only previous one with a 3-0 result for the South American.
As the teams enter the court, let's review what happened last night - Argentina managed to win for the first time in Mendoza with a key performance of Nicolás Bruno, man of the match with 14 points.

There are hundreds of young volleyball players gathered in Mendoza to witness some world-class volleyball. After a tournament held in the venue all day long, they have remained here and are eager for the game!

Another warm welcome to Mendoza for all volley fans around the world! Atmosphere is starting to build up at Polideportivo Torito Rodríguez for the rematch between Argentina and Cuba, in a little more than one hour... And here we are to show you what's going on!
